repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.title: XSS string that gets past jsoup

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
Hi,

This url encoded string

 "0%20%73%54%79%4c%65%3d%58%3a%65%58%2f%2a%2a%2f%70%52%65%53%73%49%6f%4e%28%61%6c%65%72%74%28%36%36%31%35%35%29%29"

does not get caught by the Jsoup/clean after it has been canonicalized. The result is this XSS attack

"0 sTyLe=X:eX/**/pReSsIoN(alert(66155))"

I'd love to fix it, but don't have a clue where to start.

issue.title: I Cant able to parse below generated HTML using Jsoup. Why I cant able to do?

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
I tried to parse the below HTML content using Jsoup 1.9.2. But I couldn't able to do. It returning blank object. But if I put condition _slno < 7155;_ into _slno < 7150;_ its working fine. ` <% for(int slno = 1; slno < 7155; slno++){ %> <% } %>
SLNo Heading 1 Heading 2 Heading 3 Heading 4
<%=slno%> column-<%=slno%> column-<%=slno%> column-<%=slno%> column-<%=slno%>
`
